attributes.action: change and simplify county names and boundaries in England
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This petition calls on the Prime Minister to change and simplify the names and boundaries of counties in England by reducing or merging them as they were historically. North, South, West Yorkshire and East Riding should become the county of "Yorkshire", while East and West Sussex should just be "Sussex." There should be no North East Lincolnshire, just "Lincolnshire", while Greater Manchester and Merseyside should be returned to the county of Lancashire. Such a move would slash bureaucracy, red tape and simplify politics.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Electoral Commission.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
